summary: This document is a press release and related email chain from Prince Andrew's legal team (Blackfords LLP) responding to public statements by the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, Geoffrey S. Berman. It asserts that Prince Andrew has offered cooperation as a witness three times in 2020, contradicts claims of non-cooperation, and criticizes the DOJ for breaching confidentiality rules.

events.title: First DOJ Request for Cooperation
events.description: The DOJ first requested Prince Andrew's help in their investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Berman's First Public Statement
events.description: U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman made a public statement leading to worldwide media reports of a 'wall of silence' and 'zero cooperation' from Prince Andrew.

events.title: Berman's Second Public Statement
events.description: Berman stated Prince Andrew had 'completely shut the door' on cooperating and the DOJ was 'considering' further options.

events.title: Press Release Issued
events.description: Prince Andrew's legal team issued a press release clarifying his offers of cooperation and criticizing the DOJ for breaching confidentiality.

keyFacts: Prince Andrew's legal team states he has offered to cooperate as a witness to the DOJ investigation into Jeffrey Epstein on at least three occasions in 2020.
The DOJ advised Prince Andrew's team that he is not and has never been a 'target' of their criminal investigations into Epstein.
U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman publicly claimed Prince Andrew offered 'zero cooperation,' which his legal team states is inaccurate and a breach of DOJ confidentiality rules.
The first request for Prince Andrew's assistance from the DOJ came on January 2, 2020, despite the investigation into Epstein having lasted over 16 years.
Prince Andrew's legal working group includes Blackfords LLP, Clare Montgomery QC, Stephen Ferguson, and media relations firm Riverside Advisory.
